ngoList.title: MANGOLIK
ngoList.detailsOfAchievement: MAGOLIK SAW THE LIGHT OF DAY ON 12-TH DECEMBER 1968 FOR THE FIRST TIME.IT WAS THE BRAIN CHILD OF A FEW CONNOISSEURS OF THE THEATRE WHO HAD RESOLVED TO WALK TOGHETHER.THEIR MISSION WAS TO VOICE THE THOUGHTS OF HUMANITY THE JOYS AND SORROWS THE PAIN AND PLEASURE THE DARK SIDE OF LIFE AND THE MEANS TO DISPEL THIS DARKNESS.IN 1969 AGAINST THE COMMUNIST MOVEMENT AND IN CONSONANCE WITH THE CRY OF THE DAY THE TILLER OF THE LAND IS THE OWNER OF THE LAND WE PRDUCED OUR FIRST PLAY DHAN BASED ON THE STORY BY TARUN SEN.THE BLOODY YEARS OF THE BANGLADESH FREEDOM MOVEMENT INSPIRED MANGOLIK TO ENACT THEIR NEXT PLAY ROKTAKTO ISTAHAR BY KAJOL GHOSH.IN 1972 DURING THE RESTLESS YEARS OF POLITICAL INSTABILITY AND NAXALITE MOVEMENT WE PRESENTED FULER MALA CHOTI JUTO BY KAJOL GHOSH.IN 1975 WHEN EMERGENCY WAS DECLARED IN INDIA WE TRAVELED FROM PLACE TO PLACE AND ENACTED KAJOL GHOSHS BAANSIWALLA IN THE STREETS.WE THUS RAISED FUND BY ACTING AND BOUGHT NEW DRESSES FOR POOR CHILDREN DURING DURGA PUJA.SOME OTHER PRODUCTIONS ARE CHAYA BHISSANO,SHIULI JHORAR SHABDO,MICHILER MUKH,SESH NAUKA, GADHA,SURJER KHONJE,BHUMIDAN.MANUSH BHUT,SWAPNOCHOR,MATILAL PADRI,HARUN AL RASHID.SO FAR WE ORGANIZED AND ALSO PARTICIPATE IN VERIOUS SOCIAL WELFARE PROGRAM LIKE BLOOD DONATION CAMP ART COMPETITION EDUCATIONAL PROGRAM FOR POOR PEOPLE OF PANSKURA,BETHUADAHARI ETC.WE ALSO ALWAYS TRY TO HELP THE POOR BY WAY OF BEARING THE MEDICAL TREATMENT EXPENCES,CHILDREN EDUCATIONAL EXPENCES AND MANY OTHER WAYS.2010 WILL MARK THE 42-ND ANNIVERSARY OF MANGOLIK.WE CMMEMRATED MOHIT CHATTOPADHYAY NATYA UTSAV IN 2010 TO REPAY OUR HOMAGE TO HIM.FOR LAST THREE YEARS WE ARE ARRENGING A DRAMA FESTIVAL FOR ALONG WITH ASTHA.

ngoList.detailsOfAchievement: A new production, which is an extract of three dance-dramas based on Gautam Buddha and Rabindranath Thakur, is underway. Previous productions include mainly Manipuri traditional dance-dramas such as Maharaas, Basantaraas, Nityaraas, Ghosthaleela, to name a few have been showcased time and again by the institution. All Manipuri dance and music have been composed by Guru Bipin Singh and dance direction, concept and choreography are done by Gouri Datta.

ngoList.detailsOfAchievement: Manovikas Kendra a non-govt organization of 41 years standing is functioning for assessment, diagnosis, therapeutic intervention, special schooling, vocational training, teachers training, genetic research and rehabilitation of children with disabilities and other learning difficulties. The Institute was established in 1974 by Dr. Sharada Fatehpuria in a very humble manner. Traversing with challenges in an uneven path in the field of disability, Manovikas Kendra has now emerged as a multi-dimensional service provider for the welfare of persons with disabilities. Manovikas Kendra has been registeres as a Society under Societies Registration Act 1961 of Govt of West Bengal. The Institute has been recognized as a Special School and Vocational Training Centre for the children with special needs by Ministry of Social Justice & Empowerment, Govt. of India. Manovikas Kendra has been functioning through its three centers: 1. Main Centre at E.M.Bypass, Kolkata, 2. New Alipore Centre at G Block, New Alipore 3. Rural Centre at Bonhooghly Village, 24 Parganas (S). Spectrum of Activities/Services: ï¶ Therapeutic interventions like Early Intervention, Multisensory, Physiotherapy, Occupational therapy, Hydrotherapy, Yoga-Dance-Music-Drill therapy. ï¶ Special Schooling for educational upliftment of challenged children up to secondary and senior secondary level under National Institute of Open Schooling (NIOS), Ministry of HRD, Govt. of India. ï¶ Vocational training and rehabilitation for the skill oriented children in Weaving, Tailoring, Stitching & Embroidery, Art & Crafts and Bakery & Confectionery. ï¶ Teachers Training and Programmes under approval of RCI, MSJE, Govt. of India. Jadavpur University, Netaji Subhash Open have affiliated our Instittute for conducting B.Ed Courses and Diploma Courses in Special Education (Mental Retardation). ï¶ Centre for Rehabilitation Medicine (CRM), a state-of-the-art therapeutic clinic, for the treatment and rehabilitation of patients having orthopedic, neurological,arthritic disorders, stroke, spinal injury, cerebral palsy etc. ï¶ Biomedical & Diagnostic Research Centre, approved by the Ministry of Science & Technology, Govt. of India as Scientific and Industrial Research Organization (SIRO) for conducting research on genetic causes of mental retardation under the aegis of CSIR, DBT, DST, ICMR and Defense, Govt. of India. Several scientific papers have been published in national and international biomedical journals. ï¶ Manochetna Academic & Research Centr e â€“ (MARC) This wing provides scaffolding services to children with learning difficulty and teachers of regular schools. Honours and Achievements â€¢ Coveted â€œNational Award â€“ 2006â€ in public recognition off its outstanding performance in the field of Welfare of Persons with Disabilities. â€¢ Federation of Indian Chamber of Commerce and Industries (FICCI) Award, 1999-2000, in recognition of Institutional initiative in Training and placement of persons with disability. â€¢ Rotary India Award 2003 for the outstanding contribution to the cause of Special Education and Rehabiliton of the Mentally challenged in the country. â€¢ The Telegraph Award for Excellence in recognition for â€œThe School that Caresâ€ in August 2002. â€¢ Dr (Mrs.) Sharada Fatehpuria, Founder Director, Mnaovikas Kendra, was honoured Bharat Nirman Award 2002 for social works. â€¢ Dr (Mrs.) Sharada Fatehpuria, Founder Director, Manovikas Kendra, was honoured with Rashtriya Sevaratna Samman 2009.

ngoList.title: MOTILAL CHOPRA CHARITABLE TRUST
ngoList.detailsOfAchievement: Motilal chopra charitable trust is dedicatedly engaged in social-welfare activities. It mainly aims to provide its services to the society for free of cost keeping in mind to uplift the poverty-stricken people. This charitable trust firmly believes in works that in turn being beneficial for society from the stage of developing to a developed one. Some social activists being a part of this trust are playing their role very actively .This trust is highly determined to any specific goal to get it done properly. Such specific area that has to come into limelight where the charity is giving much effort are: i. Adult certification in any trade like maybe in handicraft or Beautification etc. ii. Scholarship for poor & meritorious students who dream for higher study. iii. Distribution of study materials to poor Students. iv. Blood donation Camp. v. Other health services like Yoga. vi. Moral & Self confidence building activities like by organizing motivational session that in turn being inspirational to everyone. vii. Distribution of warm cloths. viii. Campaigning for tree plantation. ix. Various scientific work, seminar & workshop in collaboration with Department of Science & Technology. Right now it is under planning for setting up a museum in Rajasthan. As we all possess a concept of museum that itâ€™s an establishment with full of collection of a particular theme, maybe its about great personnel or object of a specific zone. The main object of setting up of a museum is to make them enlighten to common people & obviously the theme has to convey some messages to everyone . This charity is keen to highlight such personnel of Rajasthan who had proved themselves as a father of creation of wealth by their enormous activities like Ghanasyam Das Birla| Goutam singhania| Lakhsmi Mittal| Bhairon Singh Shekhawat| Maharaja Sawai Jai Singh II | Maharana Pratap Singh | Maharani Gayatri Devi | Mehdi Hassan | Pandit Vishwa Mohan Bhatt | Prithviraj Chauhan | Rajyavardhan Singh Rathore | Smt. Pratibha Patil | Smt. Vasundhara Raje.
